smell_analysis.justification: All diagrams in the provided file contain meaningful content and elements; no empty diagrams were found.

All use cases are associated with an actor, either directly or via '<<include>>' relationships (e.g., 'Vaata k천iki ootel v천i mitteaktiivseid autosid' is included by use cases initiated by the 'Autode haldur').
No use cases were found that describe the same activity with synonymous names for the same actor.
No duplicate model element names were found within the same package.
No redundant data columns were identified across tables that are not linked by Foreign Keys.
Use case naming is consistent, using the 'Verb + Noun' format (e.g., 'Registreeri auto', 'Vaata aktiivseid autosid').
In the state diagram (Page 9), all states (Ootel, Aktiivne, Mitteaktiivne, Unustatud, L천petatud) are reachable via transitions from the start node.
In the activity diagram (Page 4), all actions are reachable through the control flow from the start node.
All visible relationships on class and database diagrams have multiplicity indicators at both ends (e.g., '1' and '0..*', or '0..1').
No single diagram contains 10 or more central elements. The most populated diagram (Page 15) contains 9 tables.
No class or table has 6 or more visual connection lines on a single diagram. The maximum observed is 5 connections for the 'Isik' class on Page 6.
The diagram layout is balanced, with no related elements placed at excessive distances compared to the average.
All use cases and activity actions start with active verbs (e.g., 'Vaata', 'Otsi', 'Vali', 'L천peta').
All class, table, attribute, and use case names exceed 3 characters (e.g., 'Isik', 'Riik', 'Auto', 'kood').
All class names start with an uppercase letter and are singular (e.g., 'Isik', 'Auto', 'Klient').
All attributes and column names start with a lowercase letter (e.g., 'eesnimi', 'reg_number').
All database table names are singular (e.g., 'Isik', 'Auto', 'Klient').
No Hungarian notation or type prefixes (like tbl_, uc_, str) were found in element names.
